Label: coordinate operation
Definition IGN: Mathematical operation on coordinates, based on one-to-one relationship, that changes coordinates from one coordinate reference system to another. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 11.1, table 42 and annex B.4.
Definition ISO: process using a mathematical model, based on a one-to-one relationship, that changes coordinates in a source coordinate reference system to coordinates in a target coordinate reference system, or that changes coordinates at a source coordinate epoch to coordinates at a target coordinate epoch within the same coordinate reference system
coordinate operation consisting of the sequential application of multiple coordinate operations

Definition IGN: A non concatenated coordinate operation. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 43.
Coordinate operation in which the two coordinate reference systems are based on different datums. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 44.
Definition ISO: coordinate operation that changes coordinates in a source coordinate reference system to coordinates in a target coordinate reference system in which the source and target coordinate reference systems are based on different datums

Definition IGN: Coordinate operation in which both coordinate reference systems are based on the same datum. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 45 and annex B.4.2.
Definition ISO: coordinate operation that changes coordinates in a source coordinate reference system to coordinates in a target coordinate reference system in which both coordinate reference systems are based on the same datum

Definition IGN: Method used to perform an operation on coordinates. See ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 48 and annex B.4.5.
Parameter used by a method to perform an operation on coordinates. See ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 52 and annex B.4.5.
Value of a parameter used by a method to perform an operation on coordinates. See ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 55.
